definition: basis point (finance), abbr. to 基點|基点[ji1 dian3]
root/stem/origin/source/this/the current/original/inherent/originally/classifier for books, periodicals, files etc

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items

sentences.english: The taxation by law is the basic, issue of performing tax assignment in new era.
sentences.chinese: 依法治税是新时期做好税收工作的基本点。

sentences.english: A fun read and great underlying point.
sentences.chinese: 一个有趣的阅读和伟大的基本点。

sentences.english: Basic things to remember are, try to kite the warrior away from the totems .
sentences.chinese: 需要牢记的基本点是，试着把战士风筝离图腾。

definition: methodology/Discours de la méthode by René Descartes 笛卡兒|笛卡儿[Di2 ka3 er2], 1637
in simple terms/to put things simply/briefly
place of interest/a place one has one's eye on
same as 總而言之|总而言之[zong3 er2 yan2 zhi1]
